Short review: Needs ALOT of improvement (better sound design, better graphics, more cars, more tracks and customization etc) but I see the possibility of a good game very soon due to the fast updates.  Pros: Very quick updates (had game just over a week around 7 updates have come out since) Great cars (even has a C33 alongside other classics like 200sx and ae86) Great drift feel (update just fixed drifting now feels excellent) Great community (Lots and lots of people playing on the servers) Great scoring system (simple but works, I assume other modes will be added later but this works) Runs very well  Cons: Needs more customisation on cars (something like the old NFS games perhaps prostreet) Slightly better sound design ( some things sound a little strange and music could be reworked maybe to have a system like Prostreet or absolute drift) Better graphics not needed but wanted (maybe not required so much since gfx update)  Overall: Id say get it if you're into japanese cars, great game updating alot with a good community.

This game is pure value. At only 7 euro, you get a fun, addictive and highly replayable game that is being constantly updated by the developers, at the time of this review, supporting even steering wheels with pedals. I've tried Logitech 920 and the feedback works just fine, the throttle has enough sensitivity, the steering is on point and the overall experience works very well. Also, for controller guys, the game allows the option to connect all kinds of third party PC controllers, as well as Microsoft's Xbox 360 controller. You will most likely not need a top notch PC for this game, as the Unity engine graphics keep it simple and the overall gameplay is not too sollicitating for your machine, so anyone can enjoy it. The develpoers are continuously updating the game's graphics and textures to work and look better, so no worries about that. The game itself is rather simple, consisting of car tuning and drifting it on 5 circuits at this time. Fortunately, the tuning is in depth, allowing you to swap engines and upgrade its components, such as the block, the turbo and the NOS efficiency. The gameplay is fairly simple, consisting of starting drifts in an aracadey manner then sliding continuously in order not to lose your combo. Some tracks actually require perfect throttle control to be able to keep the skid going, offering the game a certain skill-cap and keeping it challenging. The Multiplayer mode is a great chance if you want to practice tandems or simply have some fun with your friends, as well as meet new drifters. Aside from the scripters, trolls and bug exploiters which may sometimes appear on the server, the community is quite alright and it is unlikely you will run into any issues aside from the occasional server lag. Overall, even though the game feels a tad too much like an early access title due to its lack of content, its replayability and constant updates make up for this issue and offer the buyer an addictive and fun drifting experience. I highly recommend this game, as it is one of the better cheap and fun titles you can drop a few bucks and spend a few hours on. You won't regret buying this title.

Best and most realistic drifting game I've ever played. Works great with steam controller as well.

**EDIT** The new update(2.5.0) ruined this game. The new physics make it impossible to drift and its not worth it anymore.  Dont be fooled by all the negatives and all that. This game is fun as hell, the physics arent as realistic as you might want but trust me this game is difficult to master, the physics are hard enough that when you do finally get used to it and start pulling off clean runs its really satisfying and exhilerating. The graphics arent great but the game runs well, not to mention theres multiplayer (also runs really well and has active community) theres modding so your car possibilites are endless. Pretty indepth tuning system with engine swaps and tunning of all parts of your car physically and internally all of which effect how your car behaves on the track. And last but not least the sounds in this game are incredible, I love wearing headphones and listening to that exhause rip in first person as im sliding a wide corner, its truly an awesome moment to be in and because there are about 15+ engines to swap each car can and will sound different, everything to the engine, exhaust, turbo whistle, clutch and the tires ripping on that asphalt. If you really put away your first impressions on 'this game is dumb, its a mobile game' and really try and practice its quite rewarding.

This game is fun as hell, the physics arent as realistic as you might want but trust me this game is difficult to master, the physics are hard enough that when you do finally get used to it and start pulling off clean runs its really satisfying and exhilerating. The graphics arent great but the game runs well, not to mention theres multiplayer (also runs really well and has active community) theres modding so your car possibilites are endless. Pretty indepth tuning system with engine swaps and tunning of all parts of your car physically and internally all of which effect how your car behaves on the track. And last but not least the sounds in this game are incredible, I love wearing headphones and listening to that exhause rip in first person as im sliding a wide corner, its truly an awesome moment to be in and because there are about 15+ engines to swap each car can and will sound different, everything to the engine, exhaust, turbo whistle, clutch and the tires ripping on that asphalt. If you really put away your first impressions on 'this game is dumb, its a mobile game' and really try and practice its quite rewarding.

This is an early access game (atleast I think it is), so I'll give it a bit slack. Plus I got only got this game for a dollar, so I can't expect too much.  As of right now, this game looks like the older NFS games (Between Underground and Carbon) but just drifting, with the controls being noticibly more refined for simulated racing, rather than an arcadey one. This isn't that bad, the graphics are surprisingly decent for an indie game and you can tell a lot of effort went to the cars and drifting mechanics. Plus there's also a legitimately decent driver camera and there's a good selection of popular modern and classic tuner cars to choose from.  One bad part is that the game is just badly optimized. I can run most modern racing titles just fine, but this thing struggles badly with framerate issues, even when I've restorted to almost minimal settings. Another problem is that the game's UI is too minimalistic and lacks crucial information (a pretty glaring problem for a simulator). Nothing there doesn't explain what you're suppose to do, how your tuning settings affect vehicle performance, or how races work. Sure, there's online explanations elsewhere, but the thing is; players aren't suppose to look elsewhere to explain how the game works. The game itself should be explaining the core game mechanics.  You're just suppose to go in there and either sink or swim and overall the game kinda just feels dead. Not the 'no players' dead, there's some multiplayer activity, but you have little to no interaction with everything else that the entire game feels souless.  Overall, its nice to look at and there is a lot of potential for this game, but the actual game just isn't fun right now. If you want a better low-performance racing game that has better drifting mechanics; I'd really just recommend playing NFSU2 or GRID 1 (granted GRID 1 doesn't have the tuning aspect but its' still leagues better, especially for a game that came out almost a decade ago).
